PLACEMENT—2
Dec. 11. Experienced writer, producer, director of film for theatre and TV. A.B.,
M.A., secondary certificate, course work completed toward PH.D. in literature.
Broad background in film production as free lance and for commercial producers.
Seven years experience as college instructor of literature, journalism, writing,
publications. Married, veteran, two children. Highest references from industry
and education.
Dec. 12. Director of public service and educational programs for midwest commercial
TV station seeks position as program director for educational station. Holds Doctor
of Education degree in educational foundations and is former college instructor.
Over ten years’ experience in education and teaching. Experience in theatre and
dramatics activities. TV experience consists of two years as producer and director
of public service and educational productions plus first-hand knowledge of studio
operation. Complete details of background and experience upon request.
Dec. 13. Thoroughly trained in all phases of TV production. Can handle all from
dolly pushing to directing and producing. Will work anywhere. Thoroughly trained
in all phases of radio broadcasting. Can handle all from news to classical music.
Familiar with console.
Dec. 14. Industrial designer-artist desires full time position in educational TV
as Art Director. Will ’’double" as production assistant. College graduate. Six
years experience product design, advertising art, model making, small shop operation.
Knowledge of TV station operation and procedures; has handled all phases of TV art,
flip cards to set design, at educational station. Prefer Northeast or North Cen¬
tral states.
Dec. 15. Production manager-doubles in brass as scenic designer-painter, graphic
artist and lighting director, etc. Educational station and top New York network
experience. Ideal man for small, budget-minded station. Married—two children.
Wish to relocate in Midwest, South or East. Best references. Reasonable salary
requirements.
Dec. 16. Hollywood TV-radio producer-writer-M.C. Director of more than 1000 educa¬
tional video-radio programs seeks affiliation with educational station in similar
or other capacity. Also interested in affiliation with educational institution as
radio-TV producer or radio-TV station which seeks educational or public service
program director.
Dec. 17. Experienced manager and production director in both commercial and educa¬
tional television desires position with new educational TV station or with college
or university radio and TV department. Background includes 20 years of experience
in the field. Undergraduate degree in electronics; doctorate in education. Qual¬
ified to teach all phases of radio and TV production and management, as well as
graduate courses in communications and communications research. Metropolitan area
preferred. Salary should be commensurate with that offered for corresponding
responsibility in commercial TV. Presently employed in large university.
Dec. 18. A.B., University of Michigan, 1953* TV production and relevant courses at
Columbia and Michigan. No military obligations. Personable, versatile, creative.
Supervisory directing experience at college and summer camp.
Dec. 19. Young man-27, single; experience in commercial FM "good music" station as
announcer, music commentator and member of program dept.; B.S. in Pol. Science, M.A.
in Music; high scholarship; editor, college literary magazine; concert experience
as pianist and composer; excellent references. Will consider part-time teaching
in connection with position.
